alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 5:00PM CST until December 14 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Tuscaloosa. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuscaloosa, Northport, Holt, Moundville, Brookwood, Coaling, Coker, Bryant Denny Stadium, University Mall, Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, McFarland Mall, Tuscaloosa Regional Airport, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, Shelton State Community College, Lake Lurleen State Park, Binion Creek Landing, Lake Wildwood, Samantha, Bankhead Lock And Dam and Lake Tuscaloosa Dam.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
